title: Local obituary: Henry Oberlander, 29, standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers and Bridgewater State
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Henry Oberlander, 29, died in an automobile accident in Norwood, MA on November 5, 2025.
Oberlander was a standout Xaverian Brothers High School and Bridgewater State University wrestler.
He worked as a laborer in Boston Local 560 and was pursuing a role in his father's engineering business.

title: Boston.com readers share how the reduction in flights has impacted their travels
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Air traffic reductions due to a government shutdown cause delays and cancellations at Logan and 39 other airports.
Logan Airport experienced significant delays and cancellations over the weekend, with 440 delays and 107 cancellations on Sunday.
Boston.com poll shows nearly 200 readers report travel disruptions, with 45% affected by reduced flights at Logan.

title: Former Patriot Damien Woody made a bold prediction after New England’s win vs. Buccaneers
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Damien Woody predicts the AFC road to the Super Bowl runs through Foxborough after Patriots' 28-23 win over Buccaneers.
New England Patriots improved to 8-2, tying with Broncos and Colts for the best AFC record after defeating the Buccaneers.
Patriots have won seven consecutive games, with ESPN analyst Tedy Bruschi expressing confidence in team's competitive resurgence.

title: Western Mass. police chief arrested in school parking lot, allegedly tried to solicit sex from undercover cop
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Cheshire Police Chief Michael Alibozek was arrested for allegedly soliciting sex from an undercover officer in a school parking lot.
Alibozek, on paid administrative leave, had been communicating online with the undercover detective and was arrested by State Police.
The Town of Cheshire reported the incident to the POST Commission and held an emergency meeting to appoint an acting chief.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in Tewksbury crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 56-year-old Dracut motorcyclist was critically injured in a crash near Brook Street and Janet Avenue in Tewksbury.
Tewksbury police found the unconscious motorcyclist with a head injury in the woods off the roadway Friday night.
The victim was airlifted to Lahey Hospital after being transported to Elks Lodge; the crash is under investigation.

title: Mike Vrabel had a blunt response to report about Titans owner’s alleged grudge
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel addressed rumors regarding Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk's alleged reluctance to trade with the Patriots.
Vrabel, now Patriots head coach, was fired by the Titans in 2024 after six seasons.
Vrabel highlighted the importance of playing their best in November as the Patriots prepare for a Thursday game against the Jets.

title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' bench excelled in a 111-107 win over Magic, splitting the two-game series in Orlando.
Luka Garza's 16 points and 8 rebounds off the bench were crucial, especially during a lackluster night for Neemias Queta.
Jaylen Brown scored 27 points despite struggles against Magic's Franz Wagner, maintaining his high season average.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to stay with the Boston Red Sox as their game-planning and run prevention coach.
Varitek has served various roles with the Red Sox since 2012, including the last five seasons on Alex Cora's coaching staff.
Catcher Carlos Narvaez is expected to play a key role for the Red Sox after a strong 2025 season with 15 home runs.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookie Kyle Williams scored his first career touchdown in the Patriots' 28-23 win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
TreVeyon Henderson ran for two touchdowns, including a 69-yard game-winner, with a top speed of 22.01 mph.
Rookies contributed significantly, with Will Campbell and Jared Wilson protecting QB Drake Maye from Bucs' defense effectively.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is the current frontrunner for NFL MVP according to FanDuel and other oddsmakers with +250 odds.
Maye led the Patriots to a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers, throwing for 270 yards and two touchdowns.
This season, Maye has 2,555 passing yards, 19 touchdowns, five interceptions, and 283 rushing yards for two touchdowns.
